docs.snippet: THE CITY Buenos Aires (known as B.A. for short) is the Big Apple South. More populous than Paris, with nine million people living in a metropolitan area larger than Chicago, it is one of the world's 10 great cities. Everything creative and...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE CITY Buenos Aires (known as B.A. for short) is the Big Apple South. More populous than Paris, with nine million people living in a metropolitan area larger than Chicago, it is one of the world's 10 great cities. Everything creative and destructive of which the Argentine people have been capable in the brief, turbulent life of the nation is concentrated here. As an urban achievement, the Argentine capital is impressive.

docs.snippet: When Bob Presti was kicked out of thoroughbred racing six years ago for his hidden ownership of a famous colt named Jim French, the wheeler-dealer horse broker protested, 'Why me? I only did what some of the best people in racing are doing all the...
docs.lead_paragraph: When Bob Presti was kicked out of thoroughbred racing six years ago for his hidden ownership of a famous colt named Jim French, the wheeler-dealer horse broker protested, 'Why me? I only did what some of the best people in racing are doing all the time."

docs.snippet: A five-man task force, armed with photographs and paternity-testing gear, flew to Uruguay last night in an attempt to unravel the bizarre horse racing affair that may come to be known as the Case of the Dead Ringer.

docs.snippet: The possibility of foul play at the South American end of the CinzanoLebon ringer case surfaced last night with the disclosure that at least three of the four equine parents involved were dead.

docs.snippet: "A horse doesn't speak," a specialist in animal insurance said yesterday. "A horse will never tell what happened to him. And he's an easy animal to dispose of. So if you over-insure a horse, you're putting a temptation there."
docs.lead_paragraph: "A horse doesn't speak," a specialist in animal insurance said yesterday. "A horse will never tell what happened to him. And he's an easy animal to dispose of. So if you over-insure a horse, you're putting a temptation there."

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 4 The investigators trying to unravel the suspected switching of two Uruguayan horses in American races this summer said they had put in a productive day today in stables and offices in this capital city.

docs.snippet: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 4 A Nassau County grand jury started hearing evidence today into allegations of a possible racing fraud involving the substitution of one horse for another in a race at Belmont Park on Sept. 23.
docs.lead_paragraph: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 4 A Nassau County grand jury started hearing evidence today into allegations of a possible racing fraud involving the substitution of one horse for another in a race at Belmont Park on Sept. 23.
